body.p: For the Xtensa overlay manager, the memory map looks very similar to the PMC manager shown here:

Xtensa is just simplified to no longer include overlay data or table sections. This means that there is no longer any loading something to the D-RAM but loading code sections to the I-RAM is the same. The only overlay table now necessary is put into the D-RAM at runtime and gets its fields updated by the overlay manager as overlays are mapped.
